FuncDef:
The dot1x-template command creates a dot1x template and displays the view of the dot1x template.
The undo dot1x-template command deletes a dot1x template.
By default, the dot1x template named 1 is used in the system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of a dot1x template.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 256. The default value is 1.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When 802.1X authentication is required, you need to configure the dot1x template in the system view. The dot1x template specifies the parameters negotiated between the NE40E and the 802.1X client.
After configuring an dot1x template, you can reference it in a domain. The NE40E can then perform the 802.1X negotiation with the parameters defined in the template during 802.1X authentication.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The dot1x template 1 exists by default and cannot be deleted. Except dot1x template 1, all the other dot1x templates must be created with the dot1x-template command.
